question: marriage
answer:
QUESTION
Assalam-u-alaikum Mufti Ebrhaim Sahib. This question is about the wedding ceremony. Back home(in Pakistan) the wedding ceremonies are ridiculous(all hindu culture with dancing and singing and music and mixing of males and females). The parents here want if not those but close to those type of weddings where they can sing and dance at their childrens' wedding because they are happy. Most marriages, I know have cracks that were done like that. A few of my friends here got married Islamically(segregation and pardah and no music) and it turned out excellent. My question is that if we can't convince our parents to have segregation, do we lose the barakat in our wedding and have cracks because of shaitan?
ANSWER


Share:
If the parents insist on conducting un-Islamic functions, the children
should disobey them in this regard. If there is a conflict between Shari'ah
and the will of the parents, Shari'ah will be given preference.

You will not lose the Barkaat if you disobey your parents in this regard. In
fact, there will be more Barkaat in a wedding devoid of un-Islamic
behaviour.

and Allah Ta'ala Knows Best

Mufti Muhammad Kadwa
FATWA DEPT.

CHECKED AND APPROVED CORRECT: Mufti Ebrahim Desai
